title: Extensive Social Protection Coverage
description: In 2021, Bolivia achieved a remarkable coverage of social protection and labor programs, reaching 96.94% of its population.

title: Comprehensive Social Safety Net for the Poorest
description: Bolivia's social safety net programs covered 99.34% of the poorest quintile of its population in 2021, ensuring extensive support for the most vulnerable.

title: High Child Labor Hours
description: In 2015, Bolivian children aged 7-14 worked an average of 23.44 hours per week, one of the highest in the world.

title: Inadequate Unemployment Benefits
description: In 2019, the adequacy of unemployment benefits in Bolivia was only 1.20% of the total welfare of beneficiary households, one of the lowest globally.
